intro: Myosotis capitata subsp. albida, commonly known as the white forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters atop slender stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
